pr_title: Hibernate Validator: don't skip interface annotation lookup if impl method has annotations

timeline.bodyText:
So we could discuss this 400 vs. 500 problem in this PR (as suggested here: #11341 (comment)) or we could do it separately (Zulip?).
The main challenge I see is that MethodValidatedAnnotationsTransformer is only aware of a single transformation target at a time but to check potentially present interfaces for JAX-RS annotations, the transformer needs MethodInfo/ClassInfo for those interfaces.
I guess the constructor of MethodValidatedAnnotationsTransformer has to be extended with more context...
timeline.author: famod

replies.bodyText: I think you could do something like method.declaringClass().interfaceTypes() and call .annotations() on the items of the list.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
The issue with it is that you basically only have a view of all the annotations of the type, they are not split by method.
I think you could make calls to the bean archive index by getting it through the BeanArchiveIndexBuildItem. But I'm not entirely sure it's safe to use it in the AnnotationsTransformer. @mkouba WDYT?
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: So in theory, you should be able to do TransformationContext#get(io.quarkus.arc.processor.BuildExtension.Key.INDEX) inside the AnnotationsTransformer.transform() method... or even TransformationContext#get(io.quarkus.arc.processor.BuildExtension.Key.ANNOTATION_STORE) but this could be tricky (I can smell stack overflow ;-).
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.message:
Validation: don't skip iface annotation lookup if impl method has annotation(s)

Fixes #11341
